title: Patch 6.21 Security Alert - Certificate Verification
body:
After patching 6.21, i tried logging on to League and got this Security Alert that said a secure connection could not be verified. The certificate does not match the name of the site I'm trying to view. 

Its **Issued to: **www.bing.com, 

**Issued by:** Microsoft IT SSL SHA2 

**Valid from:** 9/15/2016 - 4/15/2018

Just want to know how I can fix this and if I don't have to worry about getting haxed.

replies.body:
UPDATE: Went to the login issues area of Support. The configure DNS tab seemed to solve my problem. I hope it works for the rest of you!

I have the same problem as OP.
http://i.imgur.com/ES6AnM1.png
http://i.imgur.com/x4kSmZy.png
http://i.imgur.com/DYCGifo.png
I can close the window and play, but it reopens when I start up a match. So every time I end a match I have to minimize to get rid of the pop-up.

I re-downloaded the Digicert Baltimore Root certificate with IE and it didn't make a difference. My IE is set to default settings.

Thanks for this post. I changed my DNS to Google's DNS and the certificate went away. If anyone is wondering how to do this I will post the steps below. 

1st: Right click your LAN connection or WiFi connection down at the bottom right and select Network and Sharing Center. (You can also search for "Network and Sharing Center" if you can't find it on the bottom right of your screen.)

2nd: Click "Change adapter settings"

3rd: Right click on the current connection that you are using and select "Properties"

4th: Highlight "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)" and select "Properties".

5th: Click the bubble that says "Use the following DNS server addresses"

6th: Type in "8.8.8.8" for the preferred DNS and "8.8.4.4" for the Alternate DNS. 

7th: Click "OK" and you're done. 

Let me know if this worked for anyone.
BUMP, simple and explained very well for all of us idiots out there. i tried it out singed out and back in, no message. thank you very much for the help. i was worried that i fucked something up lol

This works because you're NOT using your ISP's DNS server. You can disable a "feature" in your personal ISP settings that changes THEIR server's settings. It's an "opt out" that you're automatically opted into when you get your internet service and you have to turn it off.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/0eT9Z4U6-patch-621-security-alert-certificate-verification?comment=0009

EDIT: ISP is still interrupting the certificate!
-> Am now using Google's DNS server to avoid my own ISP's stupid interference.
**Network Settings, properties of your connection, select IPv4 and change the DNS server to Google's (8.8.8.8 - 8.8.4.4).**


The following method worked temporarily, but the problem came back a couple days later.


**I have SuddenLink and was getting this same issue, but have solved the problem via using the ISP settings that turn OFF "Yahoo assistance".**

_NOTE: This is a setting that is changed on your ISP's server, NOT your machine._

The way I did this was by typing a really bogus address WITH the "http://" at the front like this "http://asdfasdfsafd.asdfasdfsadf".

This took me to my ISP's "error" page which ALSO included a stupid "Yahoo assistance and search bar etc". To turn this OFF I went to the very bottom of the page where it says "Powered By: SuddenLink etc" and to the right of that IN FINE PRINT is a "settings" button. Inside was an opt out of the stupid Yahoo option.

Not sure if this is ONLY for SuddenLink customers or maybe not only them but other ISPs are doing it too.. either way, that's how I fixed this issue. There may be other methods of accessing your ISP's provided user settings area, but this was how I accessed mine.

_Bing_
The reason the cert says bing is because Yahoo's search is powered by bing. Yahoo is partnering with all sorts of people (like ISPs and MS) because they're dying.

This is interesting. I too have SuddenLink, and when I went into Internet Explorer to make sure it was up-to-date, a little notification popped up saying that an "unknown program" was trying to make Yahoo my homepage instead of MSN.
Yup.. SuddenLink is known for doing shady stuff.. though they're not nearly as bad as they used to be.
Yeah also getting this issue since the 6.21 patch. Tried installing the certificates needed, reset IE's settings, all to no avail.
Having the exact same issues as the original poster. If you could help that would be most appreciative!

This is the second time I've seen this issue today, so I'm going to keep an eye on it as it's pretty unique.  This issue could be caused by Internet Explorer, which is what the client will uses for assets.  Reset your IE settings to default, and let me know if that helps get this fixed.  Let me know!

I've also been dealing with this issue. I'm still able to play the game and everything, but every time I come back to the client it pops up with the following window. [here](http://imgur.com/pqNEEmw) And when I go to view the certificate this is the window that pops up. [here](http://imgur.com/vuFRRdf) I've tried installing the certificates, and looking up additional certificates through Digicert. I've also tried taking Internet Explorer back to it's default setting. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks for all of these details.  I'll do some digging around to try and find what's going on!
If there is anything else I can provide, let me know. And thanks for the quick reply.

Yes!  When you have some time, go over every step of the [Login Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-Issues) guide to help rule out possibilities with IE and network settings that could potentially be causing this.  Going over each step with the results can go a long way.  Let me know!
I also have tried this method since I am having similar problems and it did not work

I did this, and it still didn't work. I get the Security Alert right after I log in. In the past, people have said to download a newer version of the certificate and install it. Is that something that should be done with this one as well? I can still play the game just fine, just annoying to see the alert every time I log on.

This issue could be caused by Internet Explorer, which is what the client will uses for assets.  Reset your IE settings to default, and let me know if that helps get this fixed.  Let me know!

Hey just wanted to let you know i had the same issue sometime around last patch i cannot be sure if it was when i patched or another time i opened league but essnetially i believe IE is saying HEY your accessing a site without a secure certificate and as the launcher uses IE there may be an issue with that certificate p.s. my IE has never been opened or updated (yes i know i should but im lazy)
I said yes is that bad? or more like my sister did while I was in the bathroom.

I am a  LA  player and i have the same problem  but the forum is not very active.

https://postimg.org/image/brkn7jqz3/

https://postimg.org/image/ytmtnpuoz/

This issue is different than what's being reported in this thread, and a result of a bad connection failing to connect to our patching server.  Use the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to improve your network and complete updating game files.  Hope that helps!
Yes very annoying. I close out of league and have 10 of the same window all saying security alert.
Can you provide me a [screenshot](http://imgur.com/) of the message for some context?  Are you able to close the window and continue playing?

Getting the same problem after downloading patch 6.21 yesterday. Didn't really notice it only happened when logging into League at first and was worried.

Some information about what is happening, or why it is happening would be awesome.

Hopefully Porocles keeps monitoring this and keeps us updated on any fixes.
The same thing happend to me feelsbad man D:
